intro: Palicourea veterinariorum, commonly known as the "vetinary rue," is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by berries containing seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
